summary: The bill, titled the Supporting Our Surviving Spouses Act, aims to remove the six-year statute of limitations for survivors of armed forces members who died in the line of duty on or after September 11, 2001, when filing claims against the U.S. government for survivor benefits. The bill amends Section 3702(b)(1) of Title 31 of the United States Code to achieve this. The changes apply to claims filed on or after the date the act is enacted.
